name: Umer Bhikan

experience.title: Business Analyst
experience.description: - Reviewing new technologies which can enhance process & product efficiency and recommending same to the management for implementation.- Brainstorming with the stakeholders, documenting BRS (Business Requirement Specification),making low-level designs, and getting the system developed through the engineering team.- Providing application training to the end-users, getting their constructive feedback, and takingnecessary actions if any changes are required.- Generating insights by analyzing data and helping the management in taking a certain businessdecision.- Competitor mapping around technology and business perspective.

experience.title: Associate Software Engineer
experience.description: - Understanding the client's production needs and delivering the same in collaboration with the built team.- Creating task flow on IICS INFORMATICA to automate the operation on AWS EC2 instances.- Monitoring the daily production cycle, looking into the error solving, and escalating the development need between the various cross-functional team.

experience.title: Business Analyst (Operations)
experience.description: - Providing analytics reports to internal as well as external stakeholders- Providing insights on industry-based supply chain KPIs to the business operation team.- Interacting with clients to understand their requirements and delivering the same in order to help them in the decision-making process.- Automated the data processing task using Python scripting, which cut down the processing time to 10 minutes from 30 minutes.

recommendations: Aqeel AlMeshal, MBA, CCMP ‚ÄúUmer has demonstrated exceptional skills and dedication during NFH project's Requirements Gathering phase. Umer has truly excelled in his role, showcasing a remarkable ability to communicate effectively with management and users alike. His talent in presenting complex information in a clear and concise manner has been instrumental in ensuring that project requirements are well-defined and understood by all parties involved. Throughout the Requirements Gathering phase, Umer has consistently impressed the team with his attention to detail, analytical skills, and proactive approach to problem-solving. His contributions have significantly enhanced the quality of our project deliverables and have helped steer our team in the right direction.‚Äù

Mahdi Hasan ‚ÄúUmer is an experienced champ in the lending core systems especially under financial industry sector and has a high profile and depth in understanding users requirements and transforming it in the BRDs and FSDs in particular. His contributions towards NFH digitization project is spectacular. Umer is considered a bridge builder between the business users and development team and has shown remarkable contributions towards the project during my stay in NFH.‚Äù
projects: [{"title":"1] Labours earning prediction linear regression.","description":"Data Contains Age, Race, Educational detail and Labour earning for 1974, 1975. We need to predict the labours earning for 1978"},{"title":"2] Predicting purchase of Car Insurance Logistic Regression.","description":"The task is to predict for 1000 customers who were contacted during the current campaign, whether they will buy car insurance or not."},{"title":"3] Predicting sales of Tractors Time Series","description":"The company has shown consistent growth in its revenue from tractor sales since its inception. However, over the years the company has struggled to keep it‚Äôs inventory and production cost down because of variability in sales and tractor demand. The management at PowerHorse is under enormous pressure from the shareholders and board to reduce the production cost. Additionally, they are also interested in understanding the impact of their marketing and farmer connect efforts towards overall sales."},{"title":"4] Classifying Employee Churn using Decision Tree Classifier","description":"The task is to determine which factors keep employees at the company and which prompt others to leave. Data has various data points on our employees, age, tenure, pay, job satisfaction, salary, working conditions, growth potential and employee‚Äôs perceptions of fairness. Some other variables such as age, gender, ethnicity, education, and marital status, etc, but you are most interested in whether they‚Äôre still with the company or whether they‚Äôve gone to work somewhere else."},{"title":"5)Telecom customer churn prediction","description":"The model predicts in terms of a probability for each loan transaction, whether the customer will be paying back the loaned amount within 5 days of insurance of loan."},{"title":"6) Compressor_IOT_Data","description":"Data set consist of data collected from a compressor using IOT sensors. The variables are -Suction Pressure (psig) -Suction Temperature (F) -Total Flow (gpm) -Speed (rpm) -By-pass Valve Position (%) -Discharge Pressure (psig) -Discharge Temperature (F) -Run StatusPredicting the 'Discharge Pressure (psig)' minimizing ‚Äòrmse‚Äô loss function using the regression model."},{"title":"7) Topic Modelling on Research papers using LDA","description":"Model is trained with twenty Research papers, 5 of each domain agriculture, animals, electronics & logistics respectively. And it predicts the topic of the newly provided research paper."}]
